availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Richards (Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Native of England. Son of Thomas Richards and Susana Richards. Farmer in Warren County, Kentucky in 1864. Served in the 26th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Private as from September 28, 1864 to June 30, 1865 as a substitute soldier.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 651.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 381.
Texas, Death Certificates, 1903-1982Texas Department of State Health Services, Grayson County, Texas, Registrar's No. 856, viewed on Ancestry.com on August 12, 2020.
